1. Communication: Good communication is the foundation of any strong relationship. Keep in touch regularly, and talk openly and honestly about your feelings, concerns, and aspirations.

2. Quality time: Spending quality time with friends and loved ones is important for building bonds. Set aside time for one-on-one activities and group outings that allow you to connect, have fun, and create memories.

3. Active listening: Listen actively to your loved ones when they share their feelings, successes, or challenges. Show empathy, support, and interest in what they have to say.

4. Show appreciation: Express gratitude and appreciation for the positive impact your loved ones have on your life. Acknowledge the little things they do and the sacrifices they make for you.

5. Respect boundaries: Everyone has different boundaries, and it's essential to respect them. Listen to your loved ones' needs and preferences, and avoid crossing lines that make them uncomfortable.

6. Forgiveness: No relationship is perfect, and disagreements and conflicts are bound to happen. Forgive your loved ones when they make mistakes, and offer the same compassion and understanding when you err.

7. Be present: Stay present in your relationships, both physically and mentally. Avoid distractions, such as phones and work, and focus on enjoying the moment and staying engaged with your loved ones.

To maintain these connections, continue to practice the strategies mentioned above, make time for regular check-ins, and look for ways to support and show affection to your loved ones consistently. Remember that strong relationships require effort, patience, and commitment, but they are worth it.
